msg: Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Start unminimizeEffect after the window is restored.
Same changes on both Spark and Halo Window/WindowedApplication classes. Extra imports are cleaned up in the Spark WindowedApplication class.
Start the unminimize effect after the window is restored instead of when the window first starts being restored. This is about a 300ms difference on windows.
Also cleaned up a few unused imports and private functions.
QE Notes: Re-test in both Halo and Spark components. They both had the bug.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Fix the problem where the WindowedApplication was not shutting down after closing Windows.

The problem ended up being the Window class was creating a new NativeWindow (and WindowedSystemManager) in commitProperties() before closing down. The problem is easily fixed by setting flagForOpen to false so the code will not come down this path after _nativeWindow is set to null in the close() method.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository

Updated a previous workaround so it doesn’t kick in when a window is minimized. The problem was caused by setting the height of a nativeWindow when the application was minimized. This caused AIR to restore the application. You would see a window minimize and then immediately restore.

Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Doc Notes: Changed some ASDoc comments.
http://bugs.adobe.com/jira/browse/SDK-21672 When using system chrome, setting height to 0 moves the status bar to the top of the app. and does not resize the app.
Modified commitProperties(). This looks like an AIR bug. I worked around the problem by first setting the nativeWindow to the correct size and then setting the stage.stageHeight.
http://bugs.adobe.com/jira/browse/SDK-21625 minWidth and minHeight default to incorrect values.
Modified ASDoc @default comment for minWidth, minHeight, maxWidth, and maxHeight.
http://bugs.adobe.com/jira/browse/SDK-21628 minWidth and minHeight override the width and height when set in MXML.

The height and width are set by the auto generated code before the application window is created. The problem was that maxHeight is initialized to zero and is used if there is no nativeWindow. So when the height property is set to 500 and the autogenerated code sets it before the nativeWindow is created, the height setting will see the height is greater than maxHeight and set it to zero.
I fixed the problem by initializing _maxHeight and _maxWidth to 2880 (the documented maximum width and height of an AIR window).
